intro: Leucosyke magallanensis, commonly known as the Magallanes sunflower, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has adapted to salty, windy conditions. Its yellow-orange flower heads are composed of numerous small florets, and it produces achenes as its fruit. It plays an important role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
